intro: Spergularia microsperma subsp. fontenellei, commonly known as the Fontenelle's sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. This subspecies is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland dunes. It is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showing tolerance to salt and drought. The plant plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
